articles.title: After RFK Jr.’s shenanigans, COVID shot access will be a lot like last year - Ars Technica
articles.description: Most people can get vaccinated at their local pharmacy like normal.

articles.author: Andrew Cunningham
articles.title: Microsoft removes even more Microsoft account workarounds from Windows 11 build - Ars Technica
articles.description: Microsoft has locked down well-documented workarounds in recent test builds.

articles.author: Pete Hammond
articles.title: ‘Tron: Ares’ Review: Jared Leto Goes Full-Boat AI On Greta Lee In Robotic Reboot Of Disney’s Digital Franchise - Deadline
articles.description: A review of Tron: Ares which reboots the 43-year-old franchise in an attempt to make the ever-changing AI technology still relevant to audiences.
articles.content: Certainly 1982’s Tron from director Steven Lisberger was a groundbreaking piece of cinematic CGI wizardry, but for some reason it took 28 years for a sequel, 2010’s Tron: Legacy, a father-son story t… [+4501 chars]

articles.author: Jonathan Lambert
articles.title: Babies take a lesson from soldiers in the war against malaria - NPR
articles.description: Inspired by a military strategy to ward off disease-carrying mosquitoes, researchers see if the technique will help cut malaria infections in little ones.
articles.content:
Babies may soon join soldiers in the fight to ward off malaria.
For years, the U.S. military has treated uniforms with insecticide to repel mosquitoes and the malaria they can transmit. Ross Boyce
